master_lib_variable.name: setup,lib_types_list
master_lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

This variable defines the valid set of library names.
These names, which are arbitrary strings, provide
convenient handles for specifying libraries.
These variables must use characters that are alpha/numeric/underscore only.
Examples: stdcell_hvt, stdcell_lvt, ram, io, etc

variable.name: setup,oc_types_list
variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

This variable defines the valid set of operating condition names.
These names, which are arbitrary strings, provide
convenient handles for specifying operating conditions.
These variables must use characters that are alpha/numeric/underscore only.
Examples: OC_BC, OC_WC, OC_TYP, OC_LEAKAGE, etc.

variable.name: setup,rc_types_list
variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

This variable defines the valid set of parasitic condition names.
These names, which are arbitrary strings, provide
convenient handles for specifying parasitic conditions.
These variables must use characters that are alpha/numeric/underscore only.
Examples: RC_MIN_1, RC_MAX_1, RC_TYP, etc.

variable.name: aro_enable
variable.info: This variable enables Advanced Resource Optimization. (ARO)

variable.name: aro_port
variable.info: This variable defines the port on the ARO server.

variable.name: aro_server
variable.info:
This variable defines the name of the ARO server.

This is a machine's host name.

variable.name: job_app
variable.info: This variable defines the job distribution application that will be employed.

variable.name: job_enable
variable.info: This variable enables job distribution.

variable.name: job_misc1
variable.info:
This variable can be used to provide additional controls for job distribution functions.

It's function is TBD per end-user modifications.

variable.name: job_misc2
variable.info:
This variable can be used to provide additional controls for job distribution functions.

It's function is TBD per end-user modifications.

variable.name: job_misc3
variable.info:
This variable can be used to provide additional controls for job distribution functions.

It's function is TBD per end-user modifications.

variable.name: job_misc4
variable.info:
For LSF:

This variable can be used to provide additional controls for job distribution functions.

It's function is TBD per end-user modifications.


For GRD:

This variable specifies the name of the resource
which is used to specify the "number-of-cpus-per-slot".

variable.name: job_options
variable.info: This variable defines job distribution options.

variable.name: job_queue_batch
variable.info: This variable defines the queue name that is used for batch execution of tasks.

variable.name: job_queue_child
variable.info:
This variable defines the queue name that is used for
execution of child jobs that are distributed by the primary task.
The child queue is expected to have a higher priority than the batch queue
for this job distribution feature to be effective.
If there is no provision for a child job queue, just leave this variable blank,
and the queue specified by SEV(job_queue_batch) will be used by default

variable.name: job_queue_interactive
variable.info: This variable defines the queue name that is used for interactive execution of tasks.

variable.name: job_queue_sync
variable.info:
This variable defines the queue name that is used for execution of the
synchronization jobs that are associated with the primary job for a task.
Ideally this queue should be configured to service very short jobs.

If one is not available, you can set to SEV(job_queue_batch).

variable.name: job_resources
variable.info:
This variable defines the job distribution resources.
Important Note:
Do not use square bracket characters when defining this variable!
If you need a "[" character, then use "((" instead.
If you need a "]" character, then use "))" instead.
LSF makes use of square bracket characters in resource specifications.
This causes problems in Tcl scripts, because Tcl treats square bracket
characters as command delimiters. Lynx makes the needed conversions.

variable.name: log_level
variable.info:
This variable is used by the sproc_source procedure and controls log file verbosity.
If set to "0":

When sourcing all files, quiet mode is controlled by the procedure call.
If set to "1":

When sourcing standard header files, quiet mode is selected.
When sourcing all other files, quiet mode is controlled by the procedure call.
If set to "2":

When sourcing all files, quiet mode is selected.

variable.name: metrics_enable_forward
variable.info:
This variable controls metric forwarding.
If set to "0": Metrics are not forwarded.

If set to "1": Metrics are forwarded.

Note that the MC project receving metrics must have forwarding enabled for this variable to have an effect.

variable.name: metrics_enable_generation
variable.info:
This variable controls what metrics are present in a log file.
If set to "0": Only SYS metrics

If set to "1": All metrics

variable.name: metrics_enable_transfer
variable.info:
This variable controls what metrics are sent from the RTM to the MC.
If set to "0": No metrics sent

If set to "1": Only SYS metrics sent

If set to "2": All metrics sent

variable.name: metrics_flag_errors
variable.info:
When this variable is set to "1", a task will fail if

there are any Metrics or Metrics Server errors.

variable.name: metrics_port
variable.info: This variable defines the port on the metrics database server.

variable.name: metrics_server
variable.info:
This variable defines the name of the metrics database server.

This is a machine's host name.

variable.name: project_dir
variable.info: This variable defines the project directory.

variable.name: project_name
variable.info:
This variable defines the project name.

It is also used to identify the project in job distribution and in metrics processing.

variable.name: rc_method
variable.info: This variable defines the revision control system to be used.

variable.name: release_dir
variable.info: This variable defines the release directory.

variable.name: snapshot_dir
variable.info:
This variable defines the snapshot directory.


The snapshot directory can be used to store "snapshots" of QoR viewer data. The RTM procedure "rtm_send_snapshot" is used to transfer the data to the snapshot directory.

variable.name: techlib_dir
variable.info: This variable defines the techlib directory.

variable.name: techlib_name
variable.info:
This variable defines the techlib name.

Note that the LCRM does not use Lynx DS for techlib variable management but does use the generic techlib TECH for storing information like these LCRM-specifc system and common variable configurations.

variable.name: ver_cdesigner
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Custom Designer

variable.name: ver_dc
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Design Compiler

variable.name: ver_enable
variable.info: This variable enables automation for tool version control.

variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Integrator

variable.name: ver_leda
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Leda

variable.name: ver_mvtools
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: MVTools

variable.name: ver_mw
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Milkyway

variable.name: ver_nanosim
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: NanoSim

variable.name: ver_nanotime
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: nanotime

variable.name: ver_pr
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Primerail

variable.name: ver_pt
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Primetime & Galaxy Constraint Analyzer

variable.name: ver_pylcc
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Primeyield-LCC

variable.name: ver_star
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: StarRCXT

variable.name: ver_tcl
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Tcl

variable.name: ver_tx
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: TetraMAX

variable.name: ver_vcs
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: VCS

variable.name: ver_vcst
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: VC Static

variable.name: ver_verdi
variable.info: This variable defines the version for: Verdi Suite (nAnalyzer)

lib_variable.name: lib,##LIB##,db_ccs_filelist,##OC_TYPE##
lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

Liberty files of type CCS (.db format) (##OC_TYPE##)

lib_variable.name: lib,##LIB##,db_nldm_filelist,##OC_TYPE##
lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

Liberty files of type NLDM (.db format) (##OC_TYPE##)

lib_variable.name: lib,##LIB##,gds_filelist
lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

GDS file library

lib_variable.name: lib,##LIB##,hspice_filelist
lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

HSPICE files

lib_variable.name: lib,##LIB##,lvs_filelist
lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

LVS files

lib_variable.name: lib,##LIB##,mw_reflist
lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

Milkyway Reference Libraries

lib_variable.name: lib,##LIB##,use_ccs
lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

Enable use of CCS format Liberty files.

lib_variable.name: lib,##LIB##,vlog_sim_filelist
lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

Verilog files for library cells uses for gate-level simulation.

lib_variable.name: lib,##LIB##,vlog_tmax_filelist
lib_variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

Verilog files for library cells used for ATPG with TetraMAX.

variable.name: setup,mm_types_list
variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

This variable defines the valid set of operating mode names.
These names, which are arbitrary strings, provide
convenient handles for specifying operating modes.
These variables must use characters that are alpha/numeric/underscore only.
Examples: normal, lowpower, standby, test, etc.

variable.name: tag_01
variable.info:
This is one of the 20 tag metrics which are useful for grouping metrics across the

flow. Add strings that can then be used when filtering in Management Cockpit.


LCRM users can use TAGs but they must be set in the block variables to be

honored, not the common.

variable.name: tech,nxtgrd_emf_file,##RC_TYPE##
variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

This is the NXTGRD file for ##RC_TYPE## conditions
with metal fill estimation. If you do not
have an NXTGRD file with metal fill estimation capability,
simply use an NXTGRD file without metal fill estimation.

variable.name: tech,nxtgrd_file,##RC_TYPE##
variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

This is the NXTGRD file for ##RC_TYPE## conditions
without metal fill estimation.
This file should NOT perform metal fill estimation.

variable.name: tech,tlup_emf_file,##RC_TYPE##
variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

This is the TLU+ file for ##RC_TYPE## conditions
with metal fill estimation. If you do not have a
TLU+ file with metal fill estimation capability,
simply use an TLU+ file without metal fill estimation.

variable.name: tech,tlup_file,##RC_TYPE##
variable.info:
NOTE: Not used in LCRM. Provided here to illustrate Lynx Design System capabilities.

This is the TLU+ file for ##RC_TYPE## conditions
without metal fill estimation.
This file should NOT perform metal fill estimation.

variable.name: FM_WAIT_LICENSE
variable.info:
Shell environment variable to enable license queuing for Formality.
See Solvnet for additional details.

variable.name: HERCULES_LICENSE_WAIT
variable.info:
Shell environment variable to enable license queuing for ICV.

See Solvnet for additional details.

variable.name: ICV_LICENSE_WAIT
variable.info:
Shell environment variable to enable license queuing for ICV.

See Solvnet for additional details.

variable.name: SNPSLMD_QUEUE
variable.info:
Shell environment variable to enable license queuing for synopsys tools.
See solvNet for additional details.

variable.name: SNPS_MAX_QUEUETIME
variable.info:
Shell environment variable to specify the maximum time, in seconds,

to wait for a tool feature license after the tool has started.
See solvNet for additional details.

variable.name: SNPS_MAX_WAITTIME
variable.info:
Shell environment variable to specify the maximum time,

in seconds, to wait for an initial tool license.

See solvNet for additional details.

variable.name: STARRC_LICENSE_WAIT
variable.info:
Shell environment variable to enable license queuing for STAR.
See solvNet for additional details.
